data.title: Blankets & Quilts
data.text:
Pendleton Blanket: Wildland Heroes

$299.00

In this tribute to our nation's wildland firefighters, bands of deep forest alternate with lines of flame. A portion of sales from this wool blanket helps to support the Wildland Firefighter Foundation, in aid of injured firefighters and their families...

Add to Basket

Pendleton Crib/Baby Blanket: Chief Joseph Jacquard Muchacho - Slate

$129.00

Chief Joseph commemorates one of the Northwest's greatest Nez Perce leaders. The arrowhead pattern on the blanket symbolizes his courage as he led his tribe away from the U.S. Cavalry, traveling more than 1,400 miles. Dimensions: 32 x 44 inches (81.2 x...

$329.00

Created exclusively for the American Indian College Fund, a nonprofit organization that helps fund scholarships for Native American students and tribal colleges. Your purchase of this USA-made blanket helps support their honorable mission. The arrow...

$299.00

Spanish crosses, diamond shaped “eyes” (ojos) and the symbols of the Navajo Four Mountains of Creation are dramatic in any setting. The design reverses from black background to white- an achievement possible only in mills as technologically...

Pendleton Crib/Blanket: Wind Riders Jacquard - Blue

$129.00

Made in America of our softest our virgin wool, this baby blanket is a treasured gift (and customizable with embroidery for a personal touch). Woven in a design of a desert at night, with a stallion, mare and colt galloping fast and free under the starry...

Pendleton Crib/Baby Blanket: Big Medicine Jacquard - Oxford

$129.00

Tuck them in and tell a story with a soft wool baby blanket made in America. A circle of life contains four hands representing new beginnings and the diverse peoples of the world. Seven bison evoke the seven directions, which together symbolize wholeness...

Four women draped in blankets are silhouetted against a brilliant sunset, in a colorful design by late artist and activist Apolonia Susana Santos. Atop their heads are Western-style hats; on their feet they wear moccasins and tooled boots. This blanket...

This brilliantly colored design incorporates imagery that is universal among Native American cultures: the sun, moon, stars and rain clouds represent an honored relationship with the spiritual world. The natural world is represented by flora - corn,...

$299.00

The rare white bison occurs only once in every 10 million births. In 1933, a white buffalo was born in the wild on Montana’s Flathead Indian Reservation and was called “Big Medicine” to reflect his sacred power. Many Native American...
